title: 'I travelled EU without spending a cent'
text:
'I travelled EU without spending a cent' Article By: Staff Reporter Fri, 25 Sep 2015 4:57 PM Share Your Email 
A formerly homeless man has done the impossible and travelled to every capital city in the European Union without spending a cent. 
Kris Mole (24) embarked on the challenge as a part of a charity after his sister was diagnosed with cancer. 
Mole had been homeless after developing drinking and gambling problems, but turned his life around when his sister got sick, MailOnline Travel reported. 
The trip took 165 days, as he travelled over 15 700km to 23 countries. 
According to MailOnline, the journey saw Mole roughing it mostly, but occasionally strangers would let him sleep on their couches. 
He also managed to get a hotel stay when he worked as a motivational speaker in Slovakia. 
There were several rules for his journey: no money was allowed to be spent, he couldn't use any credit cards, he had to visit every EU capital on the physical continent, he had to say yes to everything, he had to accept any donation that wasn't cash, he had to begin the challenge in a foreign country and he wasn't allowed to let "women compromise the challenge". 
His journey started after he was flown on his father's dime to Stockholm, Sweden, after which no money was spent. 
His travels weren't glamorous though. According to MailOnline, Mole went days without food and said he was close to starving when he reached Poland. 
He has chronicled his journey in a book entitled Gatecrashing Europe . Related Articles
